alert.note: Alert for De Witt; Fayette; Gonzales (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 8:48PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central DeWitt, Gonzales, southwestern Fayette and western Lavaca Counties through 930 PM CDT... At 848 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Waelder to 9 miles northwest of Shiner to 8 miles northwest of Cheapside to 7 miles north of Nixon. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cuero, Gonzales, Yoakum, Hallettsville, Yorktown, Shiner, Flatonia, Moulton, Waelder, Smiley, Cheapside, Hochheim, Westhoff, Komensky, Worthing, Leesville, Henkhaus, Edgar, Terryville, and Oak Forest. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
